alert.note: Alert for Ashland (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 2:38PM CDT until April 17 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Wisconsin, including the following area, Ashland County. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 235 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. - Local law enforcement reported portions of Highway 13 covered with water in Glidden Saturday afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Glidden. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
